description: Function: Catalyzes the synthesis of L-arginine via the acetyl cycle, an essential amino acid involved in protein synthesis and metabolic regulation; Role in LAB: Supports growth and stress response by providing L-arginine for cellular functions and polyamine production; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances bacterial vitality and fermentation performance, potentially improving flavor development and nutritional value of fermented products.

Function: Catalyzes the biosynthesis of coenzyme A, a vital cofactor involved in numerous metabolic pathways including fatty acid metabolism and energy production; Role in LAB: Supports key enzymatic reactions for cellular metabolism and growth; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances bacterial metabolic efficiency and viability during fermentation, contributing to stable and high-quality fermented products.

Function: Catalyzes the synthesis of peptidoglycan containing meso-diaminopimelate, a critical component of bacterial cell walls providing structural support; Role in LAB: Maintains cell wall integrity and shape, essential for cell viability and resistance to environmental stress; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Supports bacterial robustness and survival during fermentation, contributing to the consistency and safety of fermented products.

Function: Catalyzes the biosynthesis of CDP-diacylglycerol, a key intermediate in the synthesis of phospholipids essential for membrane formation; Role in LAB: Supports membrane biogenesis and maintenance, crucial for cell viability and function; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances bacterial stability and adaptability during fermentation, contributing to product quality and shelf-life.

Function: Catalyzes the formation of 5-aminoimidazole ribonucleotide, an important intermediate in the de novo purine biosynthesis pathway; Role in LAB: Supports nucleotide synthesis necessary for DNA, RNA, and energy metabolism, promoting bacterial growth and replication; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances bacterial proliferation and metabolic activity during fermentation, improving culture stability and product quality.

Function: Catalyzes the biosynthesis of inosine-5'-phosphate (IMP), a precursor for adenine and guanine nucleotides; Role in LAB: Supports nucleotide pool balance essential for DNA, RNA synthesis, and cellular energy metabolism; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances bacterial growth and metabolic efficiency during fermentation, contributing to robust cultures and consistent product quality.

Function: Catalyzes the oxidation of formaldehyde to formate, detoxifying formaldehyde and integrating it into cellular metabolism; Role in LAB: Protects cells from formaldehyde toxicity and provides metabolic intermediates for energy production; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances bacterial survival and metabolic efficiency during fermentation, supporting consistent product quality and safety.

Function: Catalyzes the formation of CDP-diacylglycerol from phosphatidic acid, a key step in phospholipid biosynthesis; Role in LAB: Supports membrane lipid formation essential for cell integrity, growth, and stress resistance; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances cell membrane stability during fermentation, improving bacterial viability and product consistency.

Function: Catalyzes the multi-step synthesis of guanosine nucleotides from basic precursors, forming GMP and related intermediates; Role in LAB: Provides essential nucleotides for DNA, RNA, and energy metabolism, supporting cell growth and replication; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances metabolic robustness and proliferation during fermentation, contributing to stable probiotic populations and consistent product quality.

Function: Catalyzes the conversion of D-fructuronate into central metabolic intermediates through oxidative and isomerization reactions; Role in LAB: Enables utilization of D-fructuronate as a carbon source, supporting metabolic flexibility under varying nutrient conditions; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Improves adaptability and energy yield during fermentation, enhancing bacterial persistence and fermentation performance.

Function: Catalyzes the synthesis of UDP-N-acetyl-D-glucosamine from fructose-6-phosphate, a key precursor for cell wall peptidoglycan and exopolysaccharide formation; Role in LAB: Supports cell wall biosynthesis and structural integrity, contributing to stress resistance and cell division; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances cell durability and texture-modifying properties during fermentation, improving product stability and probiotic viability.

Function: Catalyzes the synthesis of adenosine ribonucleotides from basic precursors, leading to AMP formation for nucleic acid and energy metabolism; Role in LAB: Supplies essential adenine nucleotides for RNA synthesis, ATP generation, and overall cellular energy balance; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Promotes active metabolism and growth during fermentation, supporting consistent bacterial performance and product quality.

Function: Catalyzes the recovery and recycling of pyrimidine nucleobases into nucleotide forms, reducing the need for de novo synthesis; Role in LAB: Conserves energy by reusing nucleobases for DNA and RNA synthesis, supporting efficient growth under nutrient-limited conditions; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances metabolic efficiency and survival during fermentation, maintaining stable cell populations and consistent product quality.

Function: Catalyzes the phosphorylation of pyrimidine deoxyribonucleosides to generate deoxyribonucleotides required for DNA synthesis and repair; Role in LAB: Ensures adequate dNTP pools for replication and stress-induced DNA repair, supporting genomic stability; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances cell viability and genetic integrity during fermentation, contributing to reliable strain performance and product consistency.

Function: Catalyzes the formation of guanosine ribonucleotides from precursor molecules through a series of enzymatic reactions leading to GMP synthesis; Role in LAB: Provides essential guanine nucleotides for RNA synthesis, signaling, and energy metabolism, supporting growth and replication; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Improves metabolic activity and resilience during fermentation, ensuring consistent probiotic performance and product quality.

Function: Catalyzes the stepwise synthesis of UDP-N-acetylmuramoyl-pentapeptide, a key precursor in peptidoglycan biosynthesis for bacterial cell wall formation; Role in LAB: Supports robust cell wall construction and maintenance, enhancing resistance to environmental stress and osmotic pressure; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Promotes cell integrity and survival during fermentation, improving probiotic stability and ensuring consistent texture and safety of fermented products.

Function: Catalyzes the multi-step enzymatic conversion of simple precursors into purine nucleotides (AMP and GMP), essential for nucleic acid synthesis and energy metabolism; Role in LAB: Supplies critical purine nucleotides for DNA/RNA synthesis and cellular energy, supporting rapid growth and replication; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances bacterial proliferation and metabolic activity during fermentation, contributing to stable probiotic populations and consistent product quality.

Function: Catalyzes the conversion of sugars into lactic acid, ethanol, and carbon dioxide via the heterolactic fermentation pathway; Role in LAB: Enables energy production through mixed acid fermentation, balancing redox reactions and generating multiple metabolites; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Produces diverse fermentation end-products that influence flavor, texture, and preservation of fermented foods, enhancing product quality and safety.

Function: Catalyzes the biosynthesis of menaquinol-7 (vitamin K2), a key electron carrier in bacterial respiratory chains; Role in LAB: Supports efficient electron transport and energy generation under anaerobic or microaerophilic conditions; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances bacterial energy metabolism and survival during fermentation, contributing to robust probiotic activity and improved product stability.

Function: Catalyzes the multi-step synthesis of L-arginine from L-ornithine through enzymatic reactions involving acetylated intermediates; Role in LAB: Provides L-arginine for protein synthesis, nitrogen metabolism, and cellular signaling, supporting growth and stress response; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances bacterial viability and metabolic versatility during fermentation, contributing to improved fermentation performance and product consistency.

Function: Catalyzes the multi-step synthesis of pyrimidine ribonucleotides from basic precursors, producing UMP and other essential nucleotides; Role in LAB: Supplies necessary pyrimidine nucleotides for RNA synthesis and cellular metabolism, supporting growth and replication; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Promotes active bacterial proliferation and metabolic function during fermentation, ensuring consistent probiotic activity and product quality.

Function: Catalyzes the de novo synthesis of pyrimidine deoxyribonucleotides from ribonucleotide precursors, essential for DNA replication and repair; Role in LAB: Ensures adequate supply of dNTPs for genomic maintenance and cell division, supporting genetic stability; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances bacterial survival and replication fidelity during fermentation, contributing to reliable strain performance and product consistency.

Function: Catalyzes the comprehensive synthesis of adenosine nucleotides from basic metabolites through a series of enzymatic reactions; Role in LAB: Provides essential AMP and related nucleotides for nucleic acid synthesis, energy metabolism, and cellular signaling; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Supports robust bacterial growth and metabolic activity during fermentation, ensuring stable probiotic populations and consistent product quality.

Function: Catalyzes the synthesis of UDP-N-acetylmuramoyl-pentapeptide containing lysine, a critical precursor in peptidoglycan cell wall biosynthesis; Role in LAB: Supports strong cell wall formation and structural integrity, enhancing resistance to environmental stresses; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Improves bacterial durability and survival during fermentation, contributing to consistent texture, safety, and probiotic effectiveness in food products.

Function: Catalyzes the stepwise synthesis of guanosine nucleotides from precursor molecules through enzymatic reactions leading to GMP production; Role in LAB: Provides guanine nucleotides necessary for RNA synthesis, energy metabolism, and cell growth; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances metabolic capacity and proliferation during fermentation, supporting stable probiotic populations and consistent product quality.

Function: Catalyzes the multi-step conversion of shikimate pathway intermediates to chorismate, a precursor for aromatic amino acids and other metabolites; Role in LAB: Provides essential precursors for synthesis of phenylalanine, tyrosine, and tryptophan, supporting protein synthesis and metabolic functions; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances amino acid availability and metabolic versatility during fermentation, contributing to improved bacterial growth and product quality.

Function: Catalyzes the multi-step synthesis of adenosine nucleotides from simple precursors through enzymatic reactions leading to AMP production; Role in LAB: Supplies adenine nucleotides essential for nucleic acid synthesis, energy metabolism, and cell signaling; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Supports active bacterial growth and metabolism during fermentation, ensuring stable probiotic viability and consistent product quality.

Function: Catalyzes the conversion of hexose sugars into acetate and lactate via the unique bifid shunt pathway, generating ATP efficiently; Role in LAB: Provides an alternative energy metabolism route enhancing carbohydrate utilization and growth; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Improves fermentation efficiency, acid production, and probiotic activity, contributing to desirable flavor profiles and product stability.

Function: Catalyzes the biosynthesis of 1,4-dihydroxy-2-naphthoate, a key intermediate in menaquinone (vitamin K2) production; Role in LAB: Supports electron transport and energy metabolism through menaquinone biosynthesis; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances bacterial respiratory efficiency and survival during fermentation, contributing to robust probiotic function and product consistency.

Function: Catalyzes the conversion of 3-dehydroquinate to chorismate, a precursor for aromatic amino acid biosynthesis; Role in LAB: Provides essential metabolites for synthesis of phenylalanine, tyrosine, and tryptophan, supporting protein production and cellular functions; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances amino acid availability and metabolic flexibility during fermentation, improving bacterial growth and product quality.

Function: Catalyzes the synthesis of uridine monophosphate (UMP) from orotate, a key pyrimidine nucleotide precursor; Role in LAB: Provides essential pyrimidine nucleotides for RNA synthesis and cellular metabolism; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Supports nucleotide availability for active growth and replication during fermentation, ensuring consistent probiotic activity and product quality.

Function: Catalyzes the synthesis of phosphatidylglycerol, a crucial phospholipid component of bacterial membranes; Role in LAB: Supports membrane structure, fluidity, and function, contributing to cell integrity and stress resistance; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances bacterial viability and stability during fermentation, improving probiotic survival and product consistency.

Function: Catalyzes the formation of inosine-5'-phosphate (IMP), a central precursor for purine nucleotide biosynthesis; Role in LAB: Provides IMP for synthesis of AMP and GMP, supporting nucleic acid production and energy metabolism; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances nucleotide availability and metabolic activity during fermentation, contributing to robust bacterial growth and consistent product quality.

Function: Catalyzes the biosynthesis of phosphatidylglycerol in plastid-like membranes, a key phospholipid for membrane structure; Role in LAB: Supports membrane integrity and function, enhancing cellular stability and stress tolerance; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Improves bacterial survival and membrane robustness during fermentation, contributing to consistent probiotic activity and product quality.

Function: Catalyzes the conversion of galactose to glucose-1-phosphate via the Leloir pathway, enabling galactose utilization; Role in LAB: Provides metabolic flexibility by allowing galactose as a carbon source for energy production and growth; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances carbohydrate metabolism during fermentation, improving bacterial persistence and contributing to consistent product quality.

Function: Catalyzes the biosynthesis of L-ornithine from glutamate through a series of enzymatic reactions; Role in LAB: Provides L-ornithine as a precursor for polyamine synthesis and arginine metabolism, supporting cell growth and stress response; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances bacterial viability and metabolic adaptability during fermentation, contributing to improved fermentation performance and product consistency.

Function: Catalyzes the hydrolysis of sucrose into glucose and fructose via sucrose invertase enzyme activity; Role in LAB: Enables utilization of sucrose as a carbon source for energy production and growth; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Supports efficient carbohydrate fermentation, enhancing bacterial proliferation and contributing to consistent flavor and texture in fermented products.

Function: Catalyzes the multi-step synthesis of 5-aminoimidazole ribonucleotide (AIR), a key intermediate in purine nucleotide biosynthesis; Role in LAB: Supports the production of purine nucleotides necessary for nucleic acid synthesis and cellular energy; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances nucleotide availability and metabolic activity during fermentation, promoting robust bacterial growth and stable product quality.

Function: Catalyzes the recycling of thiamin (vitamin B1) from degraded precursors to maintain cellular thiamin levels; Role in LAB: Supports coenzyme availability for essential metabolic enzymes, enhancing metabolic efficiency and stress resilience; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Improves bacterial survival and metabolic function during fermentation, contributing to consistent probiotic activity and product quality.

Function: Catalyzes the formation of 5-aminoimidazole ribonucleotide (AIR), an intermediate in purine nucleotide biosynthesis; Role in LAB: Facilitates purine nucleotide production essential for DNA/RNA synthesis and energy metabolism; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Supports active bacterial growth and metabolic function during fermentation, ensuring consistent probiotic viability and product quality.

Function: Catalyzes the breakdown of acetylene into simpler metabolites, facilitating its utilization or detoxification; Role in LAB: Provides the ability to metabolize or detoxify acetylene, supporting survival in specific environmental niches; Probiotic/Food Relevance: May enhance bacterial resilience and adaptability during fermentation processes involving acetylene or related compounds, contributing to stable probiotic performance.

Function: Catalyzes the synthesis of glycogen from ADP-D-glucose, enabling energy storage in polysaccharide form; Role in LAB: Provides a reserve energy source that supports survival during nutrient limitation and stress; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances bacterial endurance and metabolic stability during fermentation, contributing to consistent probiotic viability and product quality.

Function: Catalyzes the biosynthesis of polyisoprenoids, long-chain isoprenoid lipids involved in cell membrane and cell wall functions; Role in LAB: Supports membrane integrity and glycoprotein synthesis, contributing to cell stability and stress resistance; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances bacterial durability and metabolic efficiency during fermentation, improving probiotic survival and product consistency.

Function: Catalyzes the biosynthesis of menaquinol-13, an essential electron carrier in the bacterial electron transport chain; Role in LAB: Facilitates efficient energy production and respiratory metabolism, enhancing cellular respiration and growth; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Improves bacterial energy metabolism during fermentation, contributing to better probiotic viability and consistent fermentation performance

Function: Catalyzes the biosynthesis of menaquinol-12, an essential electron carrier in the bacterial electron transport chain; Role in LAB: Facilitates efficient energy production and respiratory metabolism, enhancing cellular respiration and growth; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Improves bacterial energy metabolism during fermentation, contributing to better probiotic viability and consistent fermentation performance

Function: Catalyzes the biosynthesis of menaquinol-11, an essential electron carrier in the bacterial electron transport chain; Role in LAB: Facilitates efficient energy production and respiratory metabolism, enhancing cellular respiration and growth; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Improves bacterial energy metabolism during fermentation, contributing to better probiotic viability and consistent fermentation performance

Function: Catalyzes the biosynthesis of cis-vaccenate, a monounsaturated fatty acid involved in membrane lipid composition; Role in LAB: Maintains membrane fluidity and integrity, supporting cellular function and adaptation to stress; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances bacterial resilience and stability during fermentation, improving probiotic survival and product quality
